items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Lower 48 Natural Gas Cash Strong; Canada Lags
items.summary: Natural gas prices advanced for a second day in the spot market as buyers in the East stocked up for a chilly second half of January. NGI’s Spot Gas National Avg. on Wednesday rallied 56.5 cents to $3.255/MMBtu.

items.title: Futures Settle: February Natural Gas Prices Plummet
items.summary: Natural gas futures could not sustain momentum on Wednesday as traders braced for stronger demand but also a bearish inventory report and a widening storage surplus.

items.title: Weekly U.S. LNG Loadings Fall by 8 Cargoes on Gulf Coast Cuts
items.summary: U.S. feed gas nominations tumbled roughly 2.24 Bcf/d since the beginning of the week, driven by maintenance and outages at two terminals.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Mixed Amid Looming Cold, Constrained LNG
items.summary: Multiple cold fronts in the near-term outlook boosted natural gas spot prices through midday Wednesday, particularly in the delivery-constrained Northeast, though not all regions shared in the gains.

items.title: EPA Aims to Limit States’ Regulatory Role as Natural Gas-Hungry LNG Plants, Data Centers Boom
items.summary: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has proposed a rule to curb the ability of states to hinder natural gas pipeline projects and other infrastructure as energy demand is on the rise and development is accelerating.

items.title: MidDay Futures: LNG Interruptions Send Natural Gas Tumbling
items.summary: Outages impacting two LNG terminals halted resurgent natural gas futures in their tracks on Wednesday, even as forecasts pointed to supportive heating demand levels over the next two weeks.

items.title: Natural Gas Storage Projections Swell as January Heating Collapses
items.summary: A warm start to 2026 has crushed heating demand and sent natural gas prices tumbling as widening storage surpluses could put inventories on track to finish the withdrawal season above 2 Tcf.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: New England Natural Gas Cash Surges Ahead of Cold
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets jumped sharply higher across New England early Wednesday as a colder weather pattern set to arrive Thursday tightened regional supply, even as LNG feed gas volumes slid and futures extended losses.

items.title: Venture Global Pulled Plant Maintenance Ahead as Weaker LNG Market Squeezed Year-End Ops
items.summary: Venture Global Inc. said higher U.S. natural gas prices and a tight shipping market that capped the end of last year impacted both its export volumes and the pricing of its cargoes in the fourth quarter.

items.title: Why Bearish Oil Bets Are Suddenly Looking Fragile
items.summary: At the start of the year, sentiment in the oil market was overwhelmingly and deeply bearish. Most forecasts pointed to a glut, and a sizable one at that. Then the U.S. struck Venezuela, took its acting president to stand trial in the U.S., and threat

items.title: API: Reviving Venezuela's Oil Sector Will Be Long, Multi-Billion Dollar Process
items.summary: American Petroleum Institute (API) CEO, Mike Sommers, alongside other industry leaders like TotalEnergies' (NYSE:TTE) Patrick Pouyanne, have warned that reviving Venezuela's oil industry will be a long, costly, multi-billion dollar process requiring

items.title: Shipping Firms Scrambling to Expand Capacity for Venezuela Oil Transfers
items.summary: Oil traders and shipping companies are scrambling to expand tanker operations to move Venezuelan crude as Washington prepares to take delivery of sanctioned oil following the ouster of President Nicolás Maduro, according to multiple sources familiar

items.title: Enverus: Venezuela To Increase Oil Output 50% By 2035
items.summary: Industry consultant Enverus has predicted that Venezuela will increase oil production 50% and hit 1.5 million barrels a day by 2035 following the capture of long-time leader Nicolas Maduro by the Trump administration.  In its most bullish scenario, E

items.title: Kazakhstan Cut December Oil Output By 230 Kb/d
items.summary: Kazakhstan cut oil production in December by more than 200 Kb/d, with output averaging 1.522 million barrels per day in the final month down from 1.759 mb/d in November. December production was also significantly lower than the full-year average of 1

items.title: Is Greenland’s Oil Really Worth It?
items.summary: Greenland’s long-dormant oil story has resurfaced, once again with US interests at the forefront. Greenland Energy and 80 Mile PLC plan to drill two onshore wells in eastern Greenland’s Jameson Land basin by the summer of 2026, the island’s first hyd
